titles.title: Airline Pilot Pension Fairness Act

To amend title IV of the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 to require the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation, in the case of airline pilots who are required by regulation to retire at age 60, to compute the actuarial value of monthly benefits in the form of a life annuity commencing at age 60.
Airline Pilot Pension Fairness Act

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

bill.summary:
Airline Pilot Pension Fairness Act
This bill prohibits a reduction in the value of pension benefits guaranteed by the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation for commercial airline pilots if they are required to retire before age 65 under federal aviation rules.
